intro: Gonatocarpus micranthus, commonly known as the small-flowered sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, where it forms dense clusters of grass-like foliage. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in spikelets, and it produces three-winged fruits known as achenes. The botanical features of Gonatocarpus micranthus make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
